filabel package¶

Submodules¶

filabel.cli module¶

CLI module of filabels program. Used to manually run the program and label the desired pull requests.

Bases: object

filabel.cli.get_repo_prs(r, state, base, session)¶
Get all pull requests of a given repository
param r:repository name ‘author/repo-name’
param state:state of the PR
param base:base branch
param session:open and authenticated session
type r:string
type state:string
type base:string
type session:requests.Session()
returns:list of JSON of the pull requests, False if something goes wrong
rtype:list, bool
filabel.cli.validate_repo_names(repos)¶
Checks whether repository name is ‘{username}/{repo}’
param repos:list of repository names
type repos:list
returns:True if all are OK, repo name of the one that is not
rtype:bool, string

filabel.github module¶

Module containing the GitHub logic used in filabel.

filabel.github.add_labels(repo, pull_num, labels, session)¶
Add all the labels to the PR
param repo:repository
param pull_num:number of pull request
param labels:labels to add
param session:open Github session
type repo:string
type pull_num:int
type labels:list
type session:requests.Session
returns:True if labels added successfully, False otherwise
rtype:bool

 configuration file containing credentials

param t:debug param

 file
returns:open GitHub session, False if something went wrong

filabel.github.token_auth(req)¶

Helper function for the GitHub session

filabel.web module¶

The web application module of filabel. Used to deploy on a public website and automatically label the PRs using GitHub webhooks.

filabel.web.check_signature(headers, d=None)¶
Verify the X-Hub-Signature
param headers:request headers
type headers:request.headers
returns:True if the signature is OK, False otherwise
rtype:bool
filabel.web.get_conf_files()¶
Get names of both of the configuration files from environment
returns:configurations files or False if something went wrong
rtype:dictionary, bool
filabel.web.get_repo_name(p_json)¶
Get name of the current repository
param p_json:json of the pull request
type p_json:JSON
returns:Name of the current repository
rtype:string
filabel.web.get_secret()¶
Read the webhook secret from configuration file
returns:GitHub webhook secret
rtype:string
filabel.web.get_username(conf, s=None)¶
Get username of the token’s owner.
param conf:credentials configuration file
returns:username of the repository owner, False if something went wrong
rtype:string, bool
filabel.web.handle_ping(headers)¶
Answer to the ping request
param headers:request headers
returns:True if the ping is OK, False otherwise
rtype:bool
filabel.web.handle_pull_request(headers, pj)¶
Answer to the pull request request and change the labels
param headers:request headers
param pj:json file from GitHub
type headers:request.headers
type pj:JSON
returns:True if pull request was handled correctly, False otherwise
rtype:bool
filabel.web.react_to_post()¶
React to POST method - find if it came from GitHub and if it was sent by the corrent event
returns:Status code depending on the success
rtype:int
filabel.web.show_main_page(s=None)¶
Show main HTML page as a response to GET request.
returns:Rendered HTML template
rtype:HTML
